reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Support the National Strategic Plans for Ending TB and On Fast-Track to Ending AIDS

description.narrative: Bhutan - TB/HIV - Ministry of Health of the Royal Government of Bhutan - MOH. This program has the following goals: To achieve 90-100-90 national targets for HIV response by 2025, and continue through the planning period, towards ending of the HIV epidemic by 2030.. To reduce TB and DR-TB burden until it no longer poses a public health problem.. The objectives of this program are: 1. To increase coverage of comprehensive package of HIV prevention services (Strategic outcome: Identify, reach, recommend and test 90% of the population at risk) by the end of June 2024. 2. 90% of the people infected with HIV knows their status by the end of June 2024. 3. 100% of the people diagnosed with HIV/AIDS put on treatment by the end of June 2024. 4. 90% of the PLHIV on treatment achieving viral load suppression by the end of June 2024. 5. Elimination of mother-to-child transmission of HIV by 2023. 6. To increase case notification rate of at least 90% among estimated TB and MDR-TB cases by 2023. 7. To maintain treatment success rate of at least 90% among drug-susceptible TB and at least 75% among drug-resistant TB cases by 2023. 8. To improve TB/HIV co-infection case detection and register at least 100% of estimated co-infected individuals from 2021 onwards. 9. To strengthen programmatic management of Tuberculosis at all levels

title.narrative: Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results

Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
